intro: Calystegia felix, commonly known as the silverleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves with a silvery underside. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pale blue to violet in color. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along fences. Calystegia felix is known for its rapid growth and can become invasive in certain regions.
